title: Microsoft Defender XDR
descriptionMarkdown:
Microsoft Defender XDR is a unified, natively integrated, pre- and post-breach enterprise defense suite that protects endpoint, identity, email, and applications and helps you detect, prevent, investigate, and automatically respond to sophisticated threats.

Microsoft Defender XDR suite includes: 
- Microsoft Defender for Endpoint
- Microsoft Defender for Identity
- Microsoft Defender for Office 365
- Threat & Vulnerability Management
- Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps

For more information, see the [Microsoft Sentinel documentation](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=2220004&wt.mc_id=sentinel_dataconnectordocs_content_cnl_csasci).

graphQueries.baseQuery:
SecurityAlert 
| where ProductName in("Microsoft Defender Advanced Threat Protection","Office 365 Advanced Threat Protection","Azure Advanced Threat Protection","Microsoft Cloud App Security","Microsoft 365 Defender")

DeviceEvents| union isfuzzy=true DeviceFileEvents| union isfuzzy=true DeviceImageLoadEvents| union isfuzzy=true DeviceInfo| union isfuzzy=true DeviceLogonEvents| union isfuzzy=true DeviceNetworkEvents| union isfuzzy=true DeviceNetworkInfo| union isfuzzy=true DeviceProcessEvents| union isfuzzy=true DeviceRegistryEvents| union isfuzzy=true DeviceFileCertificateInfo
EmailEvents| union isfuzzy=true EmailUrlInfo| union isfuzzy=true EmailAttachmentInfo| union isfuzzy=true EmailPostDeliveryEvents
IdentityLogonEvents| union isfuzzy=true IdentityQueryEvents| union isfuzzy=true IdentityDirectoryEvents

sampleQueries.query:
SecurityAlert 
| where ProductName in("Microsoft Defender Advanced Threat Protection","Office 365 Advanced Threat Protection","Azure Advanced Threat Protection","Microsoft Cloud App Security","Microsoft 365 Defender")
            | sort by TimeGenerated

sampleQueries.description: Find possible clear text passwords in Windows registry.
sampleQueries.query:
DeviceRegistryEvents
| where ActionType == "RegistryValueSet"
| where RegistryValueName == "DefaultPassword"
| where RegistryKey has @"SOFTWAREMicrosoftWindows NTCurrentVersionWinlogon"
| project Timestamp, DeviceName, RegistryKey
| top 100 by Timestamp

sampleQueries.description: Finds PowerShell execution events that could involve a download.
sampleQueries.query:
union DeviceProcessEvents, DeviceNetworkEvents
| where Timestamp > ago(7d)
| where FileName in~ ("powershell.exe", "powershell_ise.exe")
| where ProcessCommandLine has_any("WebClient",
"DownloadFile",
"DownloadData",
"DownloadString",
"WebRequest",
"Shellcode",
"http",
"https")
| project Timestamp, DeviceName, InitiatingProcessFileName,
InitiatingProcessCommandLine,
FileName, ProcessCommandLine, RemoteIP, RemoteUrl, RemotePort, RemoteIPType

sampleQueries.description: Lookup process executed from binary hidden in Base64 encoded file.
sampleQueries.query:
DeviceProcessEvents
| where Timestamp > ago(14d)
| where ProcessCommandLine contains ".decode('base64')"
or ProcessCommandLine contains "base64 --decode"
or ProcessCommandLine contains ".decode64("
| project Timestamp , DeviceName , FileName , FolderPath , ProcessCommandLine ,
InitiatingProcessCommandLine
| top 100 by Timestamp

dataTypes.name: SecurityIncident
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
SecurityIncident 
| where ProviderName == "Microsoft 365 Defender"
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

dataTypes.name: SecurityAlert
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
SecurityAlert 
| where ProductName in("Microsoft Defender Advanced Threat Protection","Office 365 Advanced Threat Protection","Azure Advanced Threat Protection","Microsoft Cloud App Security","Microsoft 365 Defender")
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

customs.name: License
customs.description: M365 E5, M365 A5 or any other Microsoft Defender XDR eligible license.

instructionSteps.title: Connect incidents & alerts
instructionSteps.description: Connect Microsoft Defender XDR incidents to your Microsoft Sentinel. Incidents will appear in the incidents queue.
